tweet: To families small and large, our new Americans, our seniors, those struggling to pay the bills: I will never stop fighting to protect your health care, push for a tax code that works for all Americans and ensure everyone has the opportunity to reach their full potential.

Republican politicians genuflected to corporate CEOs with tax cuts that exploded the debt by one and a half trillion dollars as they tore up clean air and water rules that protect our kids and our families.

Rather than stand with our middle class families, Republicans in DC support policies that will rip health care from tens of millions & passed an obscene tax bill that provided limited relief to working men & women while lavishing the top 1% with a giveaway of $50 billion per year

This Thanksgiving I’m grateful for middle class Pennsylvanians who power our economy & enrich our civic life. As I travel across the state, I am uplifted by people’s generosity of spirit, even as they struggle themselves to pay bills, put food on the table and save for retirement

Ambassador Yovanovitch and the other witnesses are bravely testifying at great personal cost to themselves. We owe it to them to listen to their stories and learn the facts. Thank you, Ambassador, for your honesty, integrity and courage.

Even as she faces scrutiny and borderline abusive questioning from Republicans during today’s hearing, Yovanovitch is unwavering in her solidarity with career public servants and highlights the importance of a nonpartisan diplomatic corps that promotes U.S. interests abroad.

Though Yovanovitch has devoted decades of service to this Nation, she has been the victim of inexplicable threats & smears by the President, his personal attorney & Fox News commentators. Despite feeling threatened by the President’s extreme rhetoric, she continues to speak out.

For 33 years, Yovanovitch served with distinction in six Administrations – Democratic & Republican – & seven countries. Her colleagues in the State Department & across the national security community describe Yovanovitch as a respected professional with credibility and integrity.

Ambassador Yovanovitch is a career public servant who has courageously served our Nation around the world to advance the interests of the United States. The story she is sharing today is deeply troubling – for our national security, and for our Democracy.

It is appalling to see individuals who have dedicated their entire lives to the safety and security of the United States smeared by a President and his henchmen who are more concerned about Fox News headlines than protecting our Nation’s democratic foundations. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1195356198347956224 …

Yesterday @ChrisMurphyCT attempted to bring the House-passed bipartisan background checks bill to the floor, which was blocked by Republicans. It’s time we hold politicians accountable including @senatemajldr who refuses to let the Senate debate & vote on gun violence legislation

Gun violence is a uniquely American problem and the first step to reducing gun violence is passing universal background checks, limiting the size of magazines & banning military-style assault weapons. These measures will reduce the likelihood of more kids dying from gun violence.

Far too often we come together to mourn the victims of gun violence in our communities, but enough is enough. We should not have to ask kids to do active shooter drills at schools while refusing to require background checks on individuals purchasing a firearm.

Our communities continue to face unconscionable gun violence. From the recent outbreak of children dying because of guns in Philadelphia, to the shooting at Saugus High School in Santa Clarita, CA yesterday, the trauma these kids faced will haunt them for the rest of their lives.

As the top diplomat to Ukraine with 39 years of service, Taylor had a unique vantage point from which to recognize how process & policy decisions impact national security & interests abroad. When he saw decisions being made that compromised U.S. interests, he chose to speak up.

I'm also thinking of all the parents who can’t hug their child today because of a sudden and unexpected death. Nothing we do will bring Scarlett or these other precious children back, but #ScarlettsSunsineAct will be a big step forward in preventing sudden unexplained death.

This legislation is named Scarlett’s Sunshine after a little girl who was lost to Sudden Unexplained Death in Childhood. I wanted to honor Scarlett’s memory and make sure we are taking all possible steps to ensure no family will have to grieve a child without knowing why.

Today I want to recognize the families and advocates on the Hill advocating for my legislation, #ScarlettsSunshineAct, which shines a light on the problem of unexpected and unexplained infant and childhood deaths.
